tribe_name: Rosebud Sioux Tribe of the Rosebud Indian Reservation, South Dakota

awards.description: ADAPTATION PLANNING AND DATA DEVELOPMENT
COOPERATIVE LANDSCAPE CONSERVATION

THE ROSEBUD SIOUX TRIBE DEVELOPS A SICANGU CLIMATE CENTER TO ASSERT TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY OVER WATER, LANDS AND RESOURCES, PROTECT TRIBAL LIFE, PROPERTY, AND RESOURCES FROM CLIMATE CHANGE, AND BETTER MANAGE AND INTEGRATE EXISTING TRIBAL PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES.
PLANNINGFORANOCETISAKOWINREGIONALRESILIENCECOLLABORATIVE
FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE OPEN LOOP GEOTHERMAL SYSTEM AT THE WHITE RIVER HEALTH CENTER
HAZARD MITIGATION GRANTS PROGRAM HMGP AND HMGP-POST FIRE HMGP-PF.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE ROSEBUD SIOUX TRIBE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM, TO ADDRESS ITS ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE ROSEBUD SIOUX TRIBE AND THE EPA. THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS A RESERVATION-WIDE PROGRAM TO SUPPORT ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS.

SICANGU VILLAGE SOLAR PROJECT

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE ROSEBUD SIOUX TRIBE IN ITS EFFORTS TO IMPLEMENT THE CLEAN AIR ACT 103 REGULATION THROUGHOUT THE ROSEBUD RESERVATION AND PROTECT ITS AIRSHED.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE THE MONITORING OF AIR QUALITY, DATA QUALITY CONTROL ACTIVITIES, ATTENDING ENVIRONMENTALLY-RELATED TRAININGS AND MEETINGS, CONDUCTING ENVIRONMENTAL OUTREACH AND GRANT WRITING, AND OTHER AIR PLANNING ACTIVITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN THE PUBLIC'S AIR QUALITY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS TO THE EPA, THE APPROPRIATE AND EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT OF EPA FUNDING, AND MEASURES TO IMPROVE AND PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE THE CITIZENS AND RESIDENTS OF THE ROSEBUD RESERVATION.

THESE ACTIVITIES ARE INTENDED TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN THE PUBLIC'S AIR QUALITY.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE THE CITIZENS AND RESIDENTS OF THE ROSEBUD RESERVATION.
